intro: Senecio fayei, commonly known as the Cayman Islands groundsels, is a flowering plant native to the Cayman Islands. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy, well-drained soils. It produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, and its leaves are usually narrow and somewhat hairy. Senecio fayei is often found in open habitats and is considered a rare endemic species.
